markdown.markdown:
Thorndyke Bay monitoring instruments are located within the [Baywater Shellfish](https://www.baywatershellfish.com/) shellfish farm. Baywater shellfish is an intertidal shellfish farm. Environmental monitoring instruments are located on oyster lines that are anchored into the ground and are exposed every tidal cycle. ![Baywater Shellfish, Thorndyke Bay, WA](/Images/Thorndyke Bay.jpg) ```{r, include=FALSE} #Load the packages required to make a local scale map library(tidyverse) library(leaflet)#package to make interactive web library(leaflet.providers)#allows you to add third party basemaps library(here) library(plotly) library(lubridate) ``` Sensors at Thorndyke Bay are deployed on a commercial shellfish farm. The sensors are located in an intertidal area at a tidal height of approximatley x cm. ```{r, echo = FALSE, results = "hide"} ###Create the map #Set the content for each point on the map content_thorndyke_UW <- paste("Thorndyke Bay, Baywater Shellfish - UW
Data: Disolved oxygen, temperature, salinity
Contact: Craig Norrie") content_thorndyke_PSI <- paste("Thorndyke Bay, Baywater Shellfish - UW
Data: data link
Contact: PSI") content_thorndyke_other <- paste("Thorndyke Bay, Baywater Shellfish - UW
Data: Seaweed
Contact: Seaweed") #Create the map - in the future set all of the variables in a csv to be read in aquaculturemap_thorn <- leaflet() %>% addProviderTiles(providers$Esri.OceanBasemap) %>% addMarkers(lng = -122.738067,lat = 47.808739, popup = content_thorndyke_UW) %>% #UW addMarkers(lng = -122.735507,lat = 47.809411, popup = content_thorndyke_PSI) %>% #PSI addMarkers(lng = -122.734758,lat = 47.809131, popup = content_thorndyke_other) #Other ``` I will change the basemap here so you can zoom in more ```{r, echo = FALSE} aquaculturemap_thorn ```
Raw data is availble [here](https://github.com/CraigNorrie/Environmental-data-website/tree/main/Data)
```{r, echo=FALSE, results='hide'} #Sumarise the data #turn this into a loop that will do this for each of the cvs files that I have in the data folder thorndat <- read.csv(here("Data", "thorn_Do_Temp.csv"))#Read in the data thorndat$datetime <- mdy_hm(thorndat$Date.Time..GMT.07.00) #Obtain daily mean data - this should probably be done in a seperate script and this should be saved for the website only thornav <- thorndat %>% mutate(date = as.Date(date, format = "%Y-%m-%d")) %>% group_by(date) %>% summarise(meantemp = mean(Temp_C, na.rm = TRUE), meanDO = mean(DO_mgL, na.rm = TRUE)) ``` ## Temperature data Temperature data was collected from hobo DO and temp logger. Data was collected every 15 minutes and daily averages were calculated. Note this data included information from when individuals were out of the water.
We can include additional lines with differtent colours for each of the locations within thorndyke to compare. ```{r, echo=FALSE, results='hide'} Thorn_temp_plot <- thornav %>% ggplot(aes(x = date, y = meantemp))+geom_line()+xlab("Date")+ylab("Temperature (°C)")+theme_bw() ``` ```{r, echo = FALSE} ggplotly(Thorn_temp_plot) ``` ## Disolved oxygen data Dissolved oxygen data was collected using a hobo DO and temp logger. Data was collected every 15 minutes and daily averages were calculated. Note this data included information from when individuals were out of the water ```{r, echo=FALSE, results='hide'} Thorn_do_plot <- thornav %>% ggplot(aes(x = date, y = meanDO))+geom_line()+xlab("Date")+ylab("Disolved oxygen (mg/L)")+theme_bw() ggplotly(Thorn_do_plot) ``` ```{r, echo = FALSE} ggplotly(Thorn_do_plot) ``` ## Carbonate Chemistry Samples were taken monthly and preserved with the addition of 200 µl of mercuric chloride. pH was determined spectrophotometrically using an ocean insights spectrophotometer. Total alkalinity was determind through volumetric titrations and the remainder of the carbonate system was paramaterised using [Seacarb in R](https://github.com/cran/seacarb). ```{r} carbchem %>% filter(Site == "Thorndyke") %>% select(-c(1,2)) %>% arrange(Year, Month) ```

The sensors are located in an intertidal area at a tidal height of approximatley x cm. ```{r, echo = FALSE, results = "hide"} ###Create the map #Set the content for each point on the map content_thorndyke_UW <- paste("Thorndyke Bay, Baywater Shellfish - UW

Data was collected every 15 minutes and daily averages were calculated. Note this data included information from when individuals were out of the water.

Total alkalinity was determind through volumetric titrations and the remainder of the carbonate system was paramaterised using [Seacarb in R](https://github.com/cran/seacarb). ```{r} carbchem %>% filter(Site == "Thorndyke") %>% select(-c(1,2)) %>% arrange(Year, Month) ```
